#summary Older LPC13xx and LPC17xx Designs

These older designs are DIY'able with PCBs for the [http://batchpcb.com/index.php/Products/44193 LPC1343] and [http://batchpcb.com/index.php/Products/44387 LPC176x] designs available at cost from BatchPCB.  Contact Opendous Inc. through the [http://groups.google.com/group/micropendousx MicropendousX Group] if you have any questions.

http://micropendousx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/MicropendousX/Hardware/MicropendousX-176x/MicropendousX-176x_Actionshot.jpg

== Features ==

  * based on [http://ics.nxp.com/products/lpc1000/lpc17xx/ LPC176x] [http://www.arm.com/products/CPUs/ARM_Cortex-M3.html ARM Cortex-M3] MCU
  * Full-Speed USB (12Mbps) and Ethernet (100Mbps) capability
  * USB-miniB and USB-A connectors and on-board GPIO-controllable [http://focus.ti.com/docs/prod/folders/print/ts3usb221.html TS3USB221] USB switch for USB Device and Host modes
  * all pins not related to USB and Ethernet are exposed on the outer headers
  * microSD connector in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MicroSD SPI Mode] on the underside of the board
  * 10/100 Ethernet based on the [http://www.smsc.com/index.php?tid=149&pid=59 LAN8720] PHY
  * [http://infocenter.arm.com/help/topic/com.arm.doc.faqs/ka13634.html Cortex Debug Header] for [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Test_Action_Group JTAG]/SWD
  * 3.3V 1A+ +/- 2% [http://www.st.com/stonline/products/literature/ds/14492/st1l05b.htm ST1L05B] regulator
  * RESET button, NMI button, and USB status LED
  * 12MHz main crystal and 32.768kHz RTC crystal
  * Dimensions (LxWxH): 3.6" x 1" x 1"- plugs into standard solder-less [http://search.digikey.com/scripts/DkSearch/dksus.dll?Detail&name=438-1046-ND breadboard]
  * completely [OpenHardware] Design, schematic/layout/assembly files available for Open Source [http://kicad.sourceforge.net/ KiCAD]. Gerber and other technical files can be [http://code.google.com/p/opendous/wiki/KiCADTutorialCreatingGerberFiles customized].
  * Design is 2-layers with 8mil/8mil trace/clearance and minimum 20mil Vias
  * Design uses minimum 0603 components for DIY'ability
